item.title: Pintos
item.description: #PintOS Pintos is a simple instructional operating system originally designed Ben Ptaff in 2004. For my Operating Systems class project, I worked with my project partner, Ben Weinshel, to implement key OS features that were purposefully absent or poorly implemented in the base version of Pintos. Part 1: Scheduling and Priority Donation Part 2: System Calls Part 3: Virtual Memory Part 4: File System Management Disclaimer Due to the University of Chicago’s Academic Honesty Policy, I may not publicly post any of the code I wrote for this class without my instructor’s consent.
